alert.note: Alert for Albemarle; Augusta; City of Harrisonburg; Rockingham (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 09 at 12:59AM EDT until June 09 at 1:30AM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 130 AM EDT FOR SOUTHERN ROCKINGHAM...NORTHWESTERN ALBEMARLE...AND NORTHEASTERN AUGUSTA COUNTIES AND THE CITY OF HARRISONBURG... At 1258 AM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Bridgewater, or 9 miles southwest of Harrisonburg, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damaging winds will cause some trees and large branches to fall. This could injure those outdoors, as well as damage homes and vehicles. Roadways may become blocked by downed trees. Localized power outages are possible. Unsecured light objects may become projectiles. Locations impacted include... Harrisonburg, Bridgewater, Grottoes, Shenandoah, Massanutten, Dale Enterprise, Elkton, Weyers Cave, Dayton, Mount Sidney, Mount Crawford, Rocky Bar, Penn Laird, Port Republic, Pleasant Valley, Mission Home, Montezuma, Swift Run, Clover Hill and Keezletown. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Albemarle; Augusta; City of Harrisonburg; Rockingham
